summary: This is a sealed court filing from Jeffrey Epstein's defense team in a civil case (Jane Doe No. 2 v. Jeffrey Epstein). The motion seeks to file a 'Notice of Continued Pendency of Federal Criminal Action' ex parte and under seal, citing a confidential agreement between Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida. The document reveals the existence of a confidential agreement related to the pending federal criminal case against Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in both the civil case (Jane Doe No. 2 v. Jeffrey Epstein) and a related federal criminal action. He is moving to file documents under seal to protect a confidential agreement with prosecutors.

persons.name: Jane Doe No. 2
persons.context: The plaintiff in the civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. Her counsel is not being served with this sealed motion at this time.

persons.name: Guy A. Lewis
persons.context: An attorney from the law firm Lewis Tein, P.L., representing Jeffrey Epstein in this civil case. He is listed as counsel of record.

persons.name: Michael R. Tein
persons.context: An attorney from the law firm Lewis Tein, P.L., representing Jeffrey Epstein. He signed the certificate of service for this motion.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: An attorney from the law firm Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A., also representing Jeffrey Epstein in this civil case.

connections.description: Guy A. Lewis is listed as an attorney representing defendant Jeffrey Epstein in this civil case.
Michael R. Tein is listed as an attorney representing defendant Jeffrey Epstein and filed this motion.
Jack A. Goldberger is listed as an attorney representing defendant Jeffrey Epstein in this civil case.
Epstein is the defendant and Jane Doe No. 2 is the plaintiff in the civil lawsuit referenced in this filing.
Both are attorneys from the same law firm (Lewis Tein, P.L.) representing Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Filing of Sealed Motion
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's defense team files a motion ex parte and under seal to file a 'Notice of Continued Pendency of Federal Criminal Action' in the civil case Jane Doe No. 2 v. Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Coconut Grove, Florida 33133 (Lewis Tein, P.L. office)
West Palm Beach, Florida 33401 (Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A. office)
keyFacts: The document confirms the existence of a confidential agreement between Jeffrey Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida related to his federal criminal case.
Epstein's defense team is actively seeking to keep details of the pending federal criminal action sealed in the related civil case, specifically to avoid disclosure to the plaintiff's counsel.
The filing demonstrates the legal strategy of Epstein's defense to compartmentalize information between his parallel criminal and civil proceedings.
The motion was filed ex parte (without notice to the opposing party) and under seal, indicating the sensitive nature of the information regarding the federal prosecution.
